Description: Body fragment of black-figured pottery open vase; interior glazed black; outside, sphinx to right, with red on wing, torso, haunch; incised rosettes with added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University College London. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
burnt exterior interior. Probably by the Polos painter.
The piece was taken as East Greek by Kardara (248, 2) but seems more likely to be Attic.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.2111)
